Extract the Latest Data for a Variable

Source: R/get_latest_data.R
get_latest_data.Rd

This conveniance function works with output from [EstZoonoticTB]{link_data} to extract the most recent data from each country for a given variable

get_latest_data(data, variable = NULL)

Arguments

data

Dataframe containing variables to be mapped. Must contain a country_code variable. This must use iso3 standard country codes. See link_data for an example dataframe.
variable

An unquoted variable name to select the most recent data for.

Value

A tibble containing the most recent estimates, by country, of the proportion of TB cases that are zoonotic

Examples



## Extract linked data
df <- link_data(verbose = FALSE)

## Extract most recent study data
get_latest_data(df, tb_z_prop)
#> # A tibble: 50 x 26
#>    country country_code g_whoregion  year tb_cases tb_inc tb_inc_lo tb_inc_hi
